text: Leonid Eremeyevich Zakharov (; born 14 January 1947) is a Russian physicist who is a researcher at Princeton University. He attended Lomonosov Moscow State University (1965–1971). He was awarded the status of Fellow in the American Physical Society, after they were nominated by their Division of Plasma Physics in 2007, for "contributions to the theory and numerical calculation of megnetohydrodynamic equilibria, stability, and transport in toroidal plasma confinement devices and for innovative ideas concerning the development of a lithium walled tokamak as an approach to an economic reactor." == References == Category:Living people Category:1947 births Category:Fellows of the American Physical Society Category:American Physical Society Category:Russian physicists Category:Moscow State University alumni
title: Leonid Zakharov
